lines.text: I don't like you at all lately. Maybe you should go see a doctor and he could prescribe you something. You know, for strength. My mother always got malt extract.
I have seen a doctor.
What, you have seen a doctor? Why? Is something wrong?
No, it's nothing.
Come on, don't fool me. Something is wrong there. One does not go to see a doctor for no reason. Does anything hurt, Therese?

[pats his hand ]
Don't worry. I am absolutely healthy.

[hurt]
Alright, if you don't want to tell me, if you don't trust me, I can't force you. I thought I'm your friend.
But Peter... I didn't know you're so dumb. Why does a healthy woman go see a doctor?
So... and does Willy already know?
No. By the way, he hasn't changed at all.
Ah. Well, neither did you, Therese.
What do you mean?
Well. You aren't none the wiser.
[pause]
Well, maybe it was a good thing that he arrived before our wedding.
You are so enigmatic today. I don't understand you at all.
Then think about it, Therese.
Say, Uncle Peter, do you think mommy and daddy will marry again?
How am I supposed to know that, Evchen? Well, for you it would be nice if you had a real father again, wouldn't it?
Yes, of course. It's just that... Barbara says that it won't go well with all of us together.
Come on, Evchen, let's play chess. It's your turn. Those are things you understand nothing about.
Yeah, you say so. I am really not that small any more as you all pretend. I just want to know what you would do then.
Me? But that is not important.
Yes, for you maybe.
Evchen, if your mother chooses your father, she doesn't need me any more. And you won't need me any more, either.
That's not true, Uncle Peter. And you know that exactly. I love you.
Yes, Evchen. But you love your father, too.
Yes, but so differently. I hardly know him. Yes, he is magnificent but... more like... an interesting uncle. You know, you... you I love... well... like a father.

[caresses her cheek]
Evchen, that's the most beautiful thing you could say to me. I'd like to thank you for that. But look, it's not about you, it's all about mommy. The main thing is that mommy is happy.
But we all were happy. You never fought. And you never ran away. And you love her, don't you?
Yes, I do, heaven only knows.

[desperate]
Then do something!
Evchen, you don't have a say in this. I can't do anything. Now come on, let's play, it's your turn.
Wait a moment, I'll get a glass of raspberry juice.
[leaves room]
